title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 2, ch. VI, pt. 309 - Application For Retirement Benefits While On An Authorized Leave Of Absence Without Pay For Medical Reasons Or While Receiving Benefits Payments From Either Workers' Compensation Or Other Employer-funded Disability Programs
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 2, ch. VI, pt. 309 - Application For Retirement Benefits While On An Authorized Leave Of Absence Without Pay For Medical Reasons Or While Receiving Benefits Payments From Either Workers' Compensation Or Other Employer-funded Disability Programs

State Regulations
§ 309.1 - Background and determination
§ 309.2 - Authorized leave of absence without pay for medical reasons
§ 309.3 - Presumption of regularity of authorized leave for medical reasons
§ 309.4 - Workers' compensation or other employer-funded disability programs
§ 309.5 - Application for retirement benefits while on an authorized leave of absence without pay for medical reasons or while receiving benefit payments from either workers' compensation or other employer-funded disability programs
§ 309.6 - Date upon which disability retirement will commence
§ 309.7 - Death of a member
§ 309.8 - Effective date

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. tit. 2, ch. VI, pt. 309

Statutory authority: Retirement and Social Security Law, §§11, 311

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
